textos_fuente.text: Premier White Water Rafting California | Bigfoot Rafting Skip to content Home Rafting Trips Guided Half Day Guided Full Day Multi Day Trips Raft Rentals & Shuttles Info About Us Frequently Asked Questions Employment Lodging Blog Contact Us Book Now Welcome To Bigfoot Rafting White Water Rafting Adventure in Northern California Book Your Trip Guided Half-Day Guided Full-Day Multi-Day Trips Rentals Gift cards Guided Half-Day Guided Full-Day Multi-Day Trips Rentals Gift cards Welcome To Bigfoot Rafting RIVER FUN IN THE MOUNTAIN SUN! Northern California‚Äôs Premier White Water Rafting Adventures on the Trinity, Klamath, and Cal Salmon Rivers. Family owned since 1984, Bigfoot Rafting is nestled in the sunny mountains between Highway 101 and Interstate 5 in Big Flat, CA. Our shop is positioned directly on the Trinity River and provides private river access with plenty of private parking and space for picnics, special events, and company cookouts. This shop is also conveniently located at the end of the Pigeon Point run, Trinity River‚Äôs most popular section, making shuttles a breeze. Book Your Trip Welcome To Bigfoot Rafting RIVER FUN IN THE MOUNTAIN SUN! Northern California‚Äôs Premier Whitewater Rafting Adventures on the Trinity, Klamath, and Cal Salmon Rivers. Family owned since 1984, Bigfoot Rafting is nestled in the sunny mountains between Highway 101 and Interstate 5 in Big Flat, CA. Our shop is positioned directly on the Trinity River and provides private river access with plenty of private parking and space for picnics, special events, and company cookouts. This shop is also conveniently located at the end of the Pigeon Point run, Trinity River‚Äôs most popular section, making shuttles a breeze. Book Your Trip Book the Trip of a Lifetime A Trip You Won't Forget From the most heart-pounding ride through thrilling rapids to a peaceful float through some of the most beautiful river bends, each and every trip on the Trinity, Klamath, or Cal Salmon River is filled with action and breathtaking natural beauty. Picture yourself paddling through stands of towering pines, rugged canyons, and crystal-clear waters teeming with wildlife. From beginner-friendly excursions to advanced whitewater runs, our expert guides ensure your experience is safe, fun, and tailored to your sense of adventure. Whether you're celebrating a special occasion, bonding with family, or just looking for an exhilarating day on the water, Bigfoot Rafting will leave you with cherished memories and stories for years to come. Book Your Trip Big Bar, CA 75¬∞ Fair Fri Sat Sun Mon Tue 86 ¬∞F / 55 ¬∞F 88 ¬∞F / 55 ¬∞F 81 ¬∞F / 52 ¬∞F 91 ¬∞F / 55 ¬∞F 95 ¬∞F / 57 ¬∞F Big Bar, CA weather forecast ‚ñ∏ How's The River? CURRENT RIVER CONDITIONS Dream Flows CDEC Water FAQ Frequently Asked Questions To have the best rafting adventure in Big Horn, it's important to plan ahead. Make sure you know what to bring, where your starting point is, and the best time to go. Here are answers to some common questions to help you know exactly what to expect. Is it appropriate to tip our guide? As it is with any service, tipping is a great way to say thank you, so if you enjoyed your ride, tip your guide. Please note there are no ATMs in town so don‚Äôt forget to bring cash. As it is with any service, tipping is a great way to say thank you, so if you enjoyed your ride, tip your guide. Please note there are no ATMs in town so don‚Äôt forget to bring cash. Due to extra work and preparation, a 20% gratuity is added to the bill on any large or multi-day trips. As it is with any service, tipping is a great way to say thank you, so if you enjoyed your ride, tip your guide. Please note there are no ATMs in town so don‚Äôt forget to bring cash. Due to extra work and preparation, a 20% gratuity is added to the bill on any large or multi-day trips. As it is with any service, tipping is a great way to say thank you, so if you enjoyed your ride, tip your guide. Please note there are no ATMs in town so don‚Äôt forget to bring cash. Due to extra work and preparation, a 20% gratuity is added to the bill on any large or multi-day trips. What do we wear/bring on our trip? Bathing suits/swim trunks and light breathable materials such as nylon or polypropylene- NO JEANS. Hat/ visor- You will also be wearing a helmet so avoid full brimmed hats. Sunglasses- Not the $200 Oakley‚Äôs, think gas station special Shoes or sandals that strap to your feet. NO FLIP FLOPS. Bathing suits/swim trunks and light breathable materials such as nylon or polypropylene- NO JEANS Hat/ visor- You will also be wearing a helmet so avoid full brimmed hats Sunglasses- Not the $200 Oakley‚Äôs, think gas station special Shoes or sandals that strap to your feet. NO FLIP FLOPS Can we bring our phones/cameras? If it can't get wet, leave it behind! Is there an age limit? Class I-II: 4 years Class III: 10 years Class IV: 18 years Our Gallery Moments We've Captured What Our Customers Say FUN RAFTING EXPERIENCE Savannah R. Tripadvisor We had a blast! This was our family first rafting adventure and so glad we went with Bigfoot! The staff was so knowledgable of the area and the water was so clean and fun to get right in! It was so nice to see the native Americans also working on the river to preserve its natural and pristine quality. I would definitely do this again. Dannielle F. Tripadvisor Super fun trip. It was our first time rafting and we had a blast. I chose this company because it had good reviews and it was right next door to the cottages we were staying in. Our guide was awesome. Sam was so nice and made us feel at ease. We felt safe with him. We had a great time and I would definitely recommend this company. Tommy L. Tripadvisor This was a first time for some and a repeat for others, and everyone had an amazing experience. Our guide, Alex, made sure that all 7 of us(regardless of skill level) thoroughly enjoyed our trip. Great rapids with plenty of down time in between for swimming and cliff jumping. Wow, can't rate it high enough. Thank you Alex- hope your arm is okay! See you next time. Lawrence B. Tripadvisor Highly recommend you raft the Trinity river if your in the area.My family absolutely loved our full day trip down the Tish Tang run.Class 2 rapids were perfect for our five year old our guide Emily was excellent.The owner Briana went out of her way to accommodate my family,she was wonderful to deal with. (Not all prohibited bases apply to all programs.) Persons with disabilities who require alternative means of communication for program information (e.g., Braille, large print, audiotape, American Sign Language, etc.) should contact the responsible State or local Agency that administers the program or USDA‚Äôs TARGET Center at¬†(202) 720-2600¬†(voice and TTY) or contact USDA through the Federal Relay Service at¬†(800) 877-8339. Additionally, program information is also available in languages other than English. To file a complaint alleging discrimination, complete the USDA Program Discrimination Complaint Form, AD-3027, found online at http://www.ascr.usda.gov/complaint_filing_cust.html , or at any USDA office or write a letter addressed to USDA and provided in the letter all of the information requested in the form. To request a copy of the complaint form, call¬†(866) 632-9992. Submit your completed form or letter to USDA by: (1) mail: U.S. Department of Agriculture, Office of the Assistant Secretary for Civil Rights, 1400 Independence Avenue, SW, Washington, D.C. 20250-9410; (2) fax:¬†(202) 690-7442; or (3) email: program.intake@usda.gov . Watch: Alleged Bigfoot Spotted Near Upper Colorado River Skip to main content Skip to site footer Trending: Advertise your business! Hall Pass Cash CSU Rams Sports Colorado Eagles Hockey Merch K99 - Northern Colorado's New Country Home On Air Shows/Schedule Tanner & Kerri in the Morning On The Job With Jess Afternoons with Matt Sparx Taste of Country Nights Overnights with Brett Alan Listen Listen Live Mobile App Alexa Google Home Recently Played On Demand App Download iOS Download Android Contests Contest Rules Prize Pickup Info Newsletter Contact Help & Contact Info Feedback Advertise More Home On Air Shows/Schedule Tanner & Kerri in the Morning On The Job With Jess Afternoons with Matt Sparx Taste of Country Nights Overnights with Brett Alan Listen Listen Live Mobile App Alexa Google Home Recently Played On Demand App Download iOS Download Android Contests Contest Rules Prize Pickup Info Newsletter Contact Help & Contact Info Feedback Advertise Visit us on Facebook Visit us on Twitter Visit us on Instagram Search The Site [WATCH] Shocking Video Claims to Show Bigfoot in Colorado Woods Kerri Mac Kerri Mac Published: June 5, 2025 KM/Canva/@_colorado_river_expeditions via IG Share on Facebook Share on Twitter Mysterious Creature Caught on Camera in Colorado We've all grown up hearing¬†legends of mysterious creatures or aliens that exist amongst us. When I was a kid, I remember going through a massive phase where¬†all I wanted to talk about was the Loch Ness monster. My teacher had read the class a book about Nessie and I was hooked. Looking back, it's clear (at least for me) that this giant sea creature doesn't actually exist and is just a fun legend. So, I'm not normally one to believe in the existence of these strange beings, but one video that was taken in Colorado¬†definitely peaked my interest. Get our free mobile app Viral Video Claims to Show Bigfoot in Colorado I was scrolling through social media the other night, when I came across a video that had me make a double take. An Instagram account called @_colorado_river_expeditions_ posted the video online and it is blowing up on social media. Where Was the Bigfoot Video Filmed? According to a report from the Daily Mail , the video was taken¬†along the Upper Colorado River on May 24th. About a dozen people were whitewater rafting with the Colorado River Expedition when they decided to pull over to have lunch. One of the people in the group pulled out their phone and captured a brief video of something strange in the woods. A hairy, and pretty tall figure appeared to be lurking around between the trees. View this post on Instagram A post shared by Colorado River Expeditions (@_colorado_river_expeditions_) In the clip, it seems to be walking on two legs. It's unclear if the figure actually saw the travelers or not. However, from the brief clip that was recorded, whatever this thing is seems pretty harmless. View this post on Instagram A post shared by Colorado River Expeditions (@_colorado_river_expeditions_) What People Are Saying About the Colorado Bigfoot Sighting Logan Kirk , one of the guides on this trip confirmed in a report that the crew was about 500 yards away from the creature. At first glance, this looks like something right out of a Sci-Fi movie like 'Rise of the Planet Apes.' The witnesses who captured the video and saw this creature in person are confident that it's Bigfoot. Staff from Colorado River Expeditions say they are going to go back out to that area soon and see if they can find this creature again. KM/Canva/@_colorado_river_expeditions via IG KM/Canva/@_colorado_river_expeditions via IG loading... So, what do you think? Is it Bigfoot or could it just be a guy in one of those¬†Ghillie Suits trying to scare hikers? Stay up to date with everything going on in Northern Colorado and beyond by downloading the free station app from your app store. Also, do not forget to follow the station across all social media platforms for the latest news and entertainment updates. Best Places to Paddle Board in Colorado Pack up the pump and paddleboard and hit the open water this summer!
